intro: Hieracium oxyodon subsp. adenoxyodon, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces yellow flower heads that are typically surrounded by bracts. It is often found in open habitats such as meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The subspecies adenoxyodon is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage and specific geographic distribution.
